info.name: Member of the Great House Background
info.author: Nick Vendel

description.p: You are a Member of the Great House, which are now become powerful guilds. After you joined years ago, you were trained by the best masters in the realm to be sure that while you're wearing House's emblem you'll do the best job you can to protect it and it's members.

ul.li: Skill Proficiencies: You can select any two skills to be proficient with
Legacy Bonus — Progenitor's Fortitude (Optional): Due to your legacy, you can select additional skill from the ones your Champion character had.
Legacy Bonus — Will of the Heir (Optional): Due to your legacy, you can select additional feat.
Tool Proficiencies (Optional): One type of artisan’s tools or one musical instrument
Languages (Optional): Choose any starting or exotic language

Equipment: a House emblem (small symbol, that fits in the hand), a set of common clothes, 5 torches, a writing kit (small pouch with a quill, ink, folded parchment, and a small penknife), and a pouch containing 20 gp.

Personality Trait
select.item: I idolize a particular hero of my faith and constantly refer to that person's deeds and example.
I pocket anything I see that might have some value.
When I set my mind to something, I follow through no matter what gets in my way.
I'm oblivious to etiquette and social expectations.
I've read every book in the world's greatest libraries--or like to boast that I have.
I stretch the truth for the sake of a good story.
I bluntly say what other people are hinting or hiding.
I often get lost in my own thoughts and contemplations, becoming oblivious to my surroundings.

select.name: Ideal
select.item: I'm loyal to my friends, not to any ideals.
My talents were given to me so that I could use them to benefit the world.
Meddling in the affairs of others only causes trouble.
If I dishonor myself, I dishonor my whole House.
My city, nation, or people are all that matter.
Emotions must not cloud our sense of what is right and true, or our logical thinking.

select.name: Bond
select.item: I didn't know my real family, but i care a lot for the new one.
My job as Member of the Great House is to protect wellbeing of other members, i take this very seriously.
I fight for those who cannot fight for themselves.
One powerful man in this country killed someone i cared about, now i'm seeking vengeance.
My town or city is my home, and I'll fight to defend it.
I want people to forget about my misdeeds in the past.

select.name: Flaw
select.item: I see everything in clear-cut black and white.
I am inflexible in my thinking.
I secretly believe that everyone is beneath me.
I remember every insult I've received and nurse a silent resentment toward anyone who's ever wronged me.
I'm easily scared, and when i'm scared i make up "reasons" to run away.
My hatred of my enemies is blind and unreasoning.

element.name: Feature: Request of the Great House

description.p: After you joined the Great House, you received necessary training and knowledge of goals and methods that your House uses to achieve them, since then you tried your best to support deals and complete requests of your House. You gain the following benefits:

ul.li: Loyalty of the House. You can request help from your fellow members. Despite the fact that many members have their own personal agendas and could refuse you request, generally, you can expect that other members will help you, as long as your request doesn't go against goals or rules of your Great House.

Deals with the Partners. Sometimes when you request help from allies of your House (this can include other Great Houses), they can decide that you and them should make a deal, after they help you, they expected that you return the favor.

Help of the Subordinates. Those who work on your House sometimes can confuse your own agenda with goals of the Great House. You have advantage on any Charisma check to convince them to help you with something, that isn't obviously dangerous or impossible for them to do.

sheet.description: You can request help from your fellow members, as long as your request doesn't go against goals or rules of your Great House. You can also request help from allies of your House, but often they will ask for a favor in return. And you have advantage on any Charisma check to convince those who work on your House to help you with something, that isn't obviously dangerous or impossible for them to do.
